title: Geopacific Resources launches equity raising, taps Petra Capital
text:
Papua New Guinea-focused explorer Geopacific Resources was in front of fund managers on Thursday, seeking to raise as much as $45 million.

Sole lead manager Petra Capital has structured the deal as a $40 million two tranche placement and a share purchase plan capped at $5 million.

The shares were on offer at 2.5¢ each, which reflected a discount of 10.7 per cent to the last close, a 16.3 per cent discount to the 10-day volume weighted average price and an 18.3 per cent discount to the 15-day volume weighted average price.

Geopacific Resources will use the fresh equity for early earthworks and camp upgrades at its Woodlark gold project in PNG; to advance project financing; and other working capital including project development and expansion.

Woodlark is located in the "ring of fire" belt which contains numerous copper and gold mines, including Newcrest's Lihir and St Barbara's Simberi.

Petra was calling for bids to be submitted by 3pm Sydney time on Friday.
